locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of the genealogy of Jesus, focusing on the inclusion of five women (Tamar, Rahab, Ruth, Bathsheba, Mary) and the historical reliability of the text versus myth.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed historical-cultural context regarding genealogies as 'resumes' and the legal status of the women mentioned.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's grace and the historical factuality of the Gospel, with occasional shifts into promising and directing.
voorbeelden: God always fulfills his promises, but he never operates on our timeframes.
The message is anyone who relates to God will have to be related through sheer grace.
Jesus Christ is that ultimate reality to which all the stories point.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To provide intellectual assurance of the Gospel's truth and to offer comfort to those feeling 'lost' or 'marginalized'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The sermon focuses on the logic of the text and the historical event rather than the present work of the Spirit in the hearing.

voorbeelden: This genealogy helps us understand what we’re going to do.
Matthew is forcing you to remember the whole story.
Jesus Christ is God’s ultimate reality becoming a fact.
Look how long it took God to fulfill his promise.
Inside the Christian church, we must not be like out there in the world.
I hope you recognize great writing when you see it.
It’s a shame, but the word that’s missing...
He will give you more than you can imagine.
All the things... will come true.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are mostly stated as general theological truths (Assertive-Commissives) rather than direct personal address.

voorbeelden: You have God’s grace if you reach for it.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with teaching authority but rarely exercises the 'power of the keys' to declare absolution or identity directly.

indicatoren: Lengthy comparison between Tolkien/Lewis and the Gospel.
Third-person descriptions of what 'Matthew is doing'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a well-explained truth rather than a participant in a saving event.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of God's action now
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual satisfaction without necessarily experiencing the 'shattering' of the Word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Conditional and descriptive rather than performative.
voorbeelden: If you believe in him... then all the things... will come true.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher as guide/teacher ('I want to look at', 'I’ll bet').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Addressing the hearer's logic and experience ('Do you know the honor?', 'You will step outside of time').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used more for hypothetical scenarios than direct proclamation.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Matthew, Jesus, David, and the women.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical and literary distance.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the Tolkien anecdote.

actueel_present.gebruik: Application to New York City life.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Genealogy) to Commissive (God's promise) to Directive (Don't judge by sense).
voorbeelden: God always fulfills his promises... so trust Him for His grace.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but weakened by the high volume of 'talking about' the pattern.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you are saved by sheer grace, you’re equally loved... we must not be like out there in the world.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is an excellent lecture on the theology of grace found in the genealogy, but it remains largely constative—describing the 'event' of the Gospel rather than being the 'event' itself.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The message is anyone who relates to God will have to be related through sheer grace.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Uses 3rd person to describe Jesus' action instead of 2nd person to enact it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'teaching event' about an 'historical event', but the illocutionary force of 'God speaking to you now' is secondary to the explanation.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon explains the means of grace (the Gospel) without fully functioning as one in the moment.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the Word, but the preacher acts more as an analyst of the text.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Moderate. The preacher speaks with authority on the text's meaning.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the claim of Christianity.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is sought through logical persuasion and narrative beauty.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the Gospel as a 'fact' to be accepted rather than a 'sacrament' to be received.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ is that ultimate reality.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'Matthew shows' to 'God says'; from 'Jesus brought them' to 'Jesus brings you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The message is anyone who relates to God will have to be related through sheer grace.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God relates to you by sheer grace; I declare to you that your 'resume' is shredded at the foot of the cross.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general principle to a specific, present-tense declaration.

voorbeeldzinnen: Because of Jesus, God promises that your name will never perish.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'talking about' Matthew and David.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the hearer as the 'Tamar' or 'David' of the story.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like Tamar, are brought into the family today.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is good, though the indicative is too descriptive.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is homiletically brilliant in its exegesis and narrative arc, but would benefit from a more 'sacramental' courage to speak in the name of God directly to the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending 'information' about grace, but is the means through which the 'Declarative' of God's grace occurs.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The analysis shows the sermon succeeds as a 'speech' (rhetoric) but is stuck in 'Assertives' (SAT), failing to fully become an 'event'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'Constative Surplus' (talking about the genealogy) prevents the sermon from becoming a 'Declarative' act of inclusion.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Jesus Christ is that ultimate reality to which all the stories point.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent for teaching, but remains a description.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is not ashamed to call us brothers and sisters.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High comfort, but would be stronger as 'He is not ashamed of you'.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Tolkien' narrative to create a sense of wonder, which functions as a perlocutionary strategy rather than an illocutionary act.
